item.title: All Call Of Duty: Black Ops 7 Launch Weapons And Equipment
item.content:encoded:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 is finally here, and Activision has announced all of the weapons and equipment coming to the game’s multiplayer at launch.

This year’s game will launch with 30 weapons with a mix of popular types from Assault Rifles to Shotguns to Sniper Rifles. Each weapon has unique attributes and features that cater to a specific type of player. Regarding equipment, there are 27 options ranging from tactical to lethal to field upgrades.

Check out the full list of Black Ops 7 weapons and equipment below. Or you can jump directly to the category you want by clicking the appropriate link:

  • Assault Rifles
  • Submachine Guns
  • Shotguns
  • Light Machine Guns
  • Marksman Rifles
  • Sniper Rifles
  • Secondary
  • Melee
  • Equipment

And be sure to let us know what else you would’ve liked to see from the Black Ops 7 launch weapons and equipment down in the comments and be sure to join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

Black Ops 7 Launch Weapons

As mentioned, there are 30 launch weapons available to players in Black Ops 7. Breaking it down further, there are 23 primary weapons, five secondary, and two melees. You can check them all out for yourself below along with unlock details, attachment types, and more.

Primary Weapons

Assault Rifles

M15 MOD 0

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto assault rifle. Well-rounded with power, handling, and accuracy.

MXR-17

  • Unlock Level: 16
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Comb, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto assault rifle. High accuracy and range but has a slower rate of fire and mobility.

Peacekeeper M1

  • Unlock Level: 52
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto assault rifle. Higher mobility and handling at the cost of high recoil and limited range.

X9 Maverick

  • Unlock Level: 28
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Three-round burst rifle. Slow handling but has high damage and recoil control.

DS20 Mirage

  • Unlock Level: 37
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto assault rifle. Includes underbarrel grenade launcher.

AK-27

  • Unlock Level: 4
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto assault rifle. High Damage and low vertical recoil

Submachine Guns (SMGs)

Ryden 45K

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto submachine gun. Balance for close-quarters combat.

Dravec 45

  • Unlock Level: 34
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto submachine gun. Very low recoil but has lower damage.

Razor 9mm

  • Unlock Level: 19
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Stock Pad, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto submachine gun. High rate of fire but lower range.

Carbon 57

  • Unlock Level: 46
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto submachine gun. Higher ammo count but below average damage.

MPC-25

  • Unlock Level: 55
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto submachine gun. Very high damage, mobility, and handling but with lower range and high recoil.

RK-9

  • Unlock Level: 7
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Three-round burst submachine gun. Better for upper body and headshots.

Shotguns

M10 Breacher

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Pump-action charge shotgun

Echo 12

  • Unlock Level: 22
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Rechambering double-barrel shotgun

Akita

  • Unlock Level: 40
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto Shotgun

Light Machine Guns (LMG)

MK.78

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto light machine gun. High damage and ammo count

XM325

  • Unlock Level: 31
  • Attachment Types:  Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto light machine gun. Fast fire rate but has higher recoil.

Marksman Rifles

M8A1

  • Unlock Level: 10
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Four-round burst marksman rifle. High rate of fire.

Warden 308

  • Unlock Level: 25
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Comb, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Semi-auto Marksman Rifle. High damage with a double-action fire delay.

M34 Novaline

  • Unlock Level: 49
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Two-round burst Marksman Rifle

Sniper Rifles

VS Recon

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Stock Pad, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Bolt-action sniper rifle

XR-3 Ion

  • Unlock Level: 43
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Underbarrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Three-round burst sniper rifle

Shadow SK

  • Unlock Level: 13
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Comb, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Semi-auto sniper rifle

Secondary Weapons

Pistols

Jäger 45

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Semi-auto pistol

Coda 9

  • Unlock Level: 34
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Full-auto pistol

Velox 5.7

  • Unlock Level: 13
  • Attachment Types: Optic, Muzzle, Barrel, Magazine, Rear Grip, Stock, Laser, Fire Mods
  • Details: Three-round burst pistol

Launchers

A.R.C. M1

  • Unlock Level: 25
  • Attachment Types: None
  • Details: Charge Launcher that delivers high damage to scorestreaks and vehicles.

AAROW 109

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: None
  • Details: Hybrid launcher. Locks on to vehicles and scorestreaks.

Melee Weapons

Knife

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Attachment Types: None
  • Details: Melee weapon with short range.

Flatline Mk.II

  • Unlock Level: 49
  • Attachment Types: None
  • Details: Melee weapon with short to moderate range.

Black Ops 7 Equipment

Moving on to equipment, there are nine tacticals, eight lethals, and 10 field upgrades to unlock and choose from.

Tactical

Stun Grenade

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Details: Slow’s victim’s movement and aiming.

EMP Grenade

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Details: Disables or destroys electronics.

Flashbang

  • Unlock Level: 15
  • Details: Blinds and deafens targets.

Pinpoint Grenade

  • Unlock Level: 8
  • Details: Grenade that detects enemies within its range.

Stim Shot

  • Unlock Level: 21
  • Details: Military stimulant that quickly heals combat wounds.

Psych Grenade

  • Unlock Level: 29
  • Details: Explodes on impact, releasing a lingering cloud of hallucinogenic gas.

Hunter Bot

  • Unlock Level: 42
  • Details: Personal defense drone hovers in air and targets enemy equipment, field upgrades, and scorestreaks. Can counter grenades.

Smoke

  • Unlock Level: 35
  • Details: Deploys a smoke screen that blocks vision and automated targeting systems.

Decoy

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Details: Grenade that simulates gunfire sounds.

Lethal

Frag

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Details Cookable fragmentation grenade.

Sticky Grenade

  • Unlock Level: 12
  • Details: Timed sticky grenade.

Cluster Grenade (Lethal)

  • Unlock Level: 5
  • Details: Grenade that scatters smaller explosives when detonated.

Combat Axe (Lethal)

  • Unlock Level: 54
  • Details: Throwing axe that kills in one hit.

Point Turret (Lethal)

  • Unlock Level: 33
  • Details: Small deployable sentry turret that automatically shoots at enemies, distracting and damaging them.

Needle Drone

  • Unlock Level: 18
  • Details: Small flying drone that explodes on impact. Can have auto or manual control.

C4 (Lethal)

  • Unlock Level: 41
  • Details: Large explosive that sticks to surfaces and can be detonated remotely when the equipment is depleted or immediately detonated.

Molotov (Lethal)

  • Unlock Level: 26
  • Details: Thrown incendiary weapon that creates a patch of flames.

Field Upgrades

Assault Pack

  • Unlock Level: 1
  • Details: Extra ammo and equipment to resupply your team.

Drone Pod

  • Unlock Level: 6
  • Details: Deployable device that launches aerial drones. Drones seek out enemies and explode.

Trophy System

  • Unlock Level: 9
  • Details: Area defense system that destroys enemy projectiles in the air.

Active Camo

  • Unlock Level: 51
  • Details: Become partially invisible for a short period of time.

Echo Unit

  • Unlock Level: 27
  • Details: Holographic soldier decoy tricks enemies and captures and holds objectives.

Squad Link

  • Unlock Level: 20
  • Details: Deployed device that boosts score and improves effectiveness of allied Operators and gadgets in range.

Scrambler

  • Unlock Level: 45
  • Details: Disrupts nearby enemy equipment, field upgrades, scorestreaks, and minimaps.

Fear Trap

  • Unlock Level: 32
  • Details: Deployed trap which emits a neurotoxic gas cloud, causing severe hallucinations and disorienting victims.

Black Hat

  • Unlock Level: 38
  • Details: Field Upgrade that hacks enemies, equipment, and scorestreaks. Aim continuously at a target to hack it.

Mute Field

  • Unlock Level: 14
  • Details: Stealth device which gives you the Ninja, Ghost, and Cold Blooded Perks for a duration. The duration extends on kills.

For more Insider Gaming and Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, check out all of Zombies maps coming to the game at launch. There are even details on Zombies level unlocks that you may have missed. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Fortnite Will Add Changes to the Revive System in Chapter 7, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite is reportedly introducing new changes to the game’s revive system, including self-revive and a new feature for reboot vans in Chapter 7.

The Simpsons have taken over Fortnite as we wait for Chapter 6 to come to a close. While waiting for Chapter 7, several new leaks about the title have surfaced online, including reports about a collaboration with Kill Bill and adding a general Hollywood setting to the game. Now, it seems that the developers might be introducing some new gameplay elements as well by adding new additions to Fortnite’s revive system.

Fortnite is Getting Self-Revive and Drivable Reboot Vans

The latest leak about changes to Fortnite’s revive system comes through NotPaloLeaks on X (formerly Twitter), corroborated by a reliable Fortnite leaks source, ShiinaBR. The latest post on the platform states that “self-revive” and “drivable reboot vans” will arrive with Chapter 7. When asked in the comment section how self-revive will work in the upcoming Chapter, NotPaloLeaks revealed that they have heard the system will be “similar to Apex or Warzone, like a token”, however, they aren’t sure about it.

Many players in the comment section have also criticized Fortnite for copying Call of Duty and Warzone’s self-revive system; however, we still do not know how it works or whether it will be implemented. Drivable reboot vans seem like an interesting addition, as they will completely change the reboot vans players target in the game. Usually, a van outside the circle was considered useless, but if this feature is indeed coming, then players can move those vans back into the circle and initiate the reboot process in a safe space. However, as these are leaks, players should treat this information with caution.

In other news, Ned Flanders has eliminated more than 33,000 players globally. Additionally, here is when Fortnite’s Chapter 7 is scheduled to arrive. What are your thoughts on Fortnite getting self-revive and drivable reboot vans in the next Chapter? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Shuhei Yoshida ‘Absolutely Wanted’ Stellar Blade On PlayStation After Playing It
item.content:encoded:
Stellar Blade has been stellar in every sense of the word. The hit action title has been universally well-received, and much more Stellar Blade content is on the way. Much of this was already known. However, what isn’t as evident is that the iconic PlayStation veteran had a huge say in the franchise coming to PlayStation 5 first.

Many consider Shuhei Yoshida a godfather of gaming and a bona fide PlayStation guru. Yoshida assumed various roles within PlayStation over the course of his 30-plus-year career there. We’ve since learned that one of his final contributions to the company was recommending and securing Stellar Blade.

Stellar Blade On PS5 Helped By Legendary Shuhei Yoshida

Through Minimap, we’ve learned that Shuhei Yoshida visited Shift Up’s Korean studio during the game’s development. He’d gotten wind of an “outstanding console game” being worked on and decided to visit the team and try it out.

Yoshida was immediately impressed:

“To my surprise, the new project had exceptional quality across the board-3D modeling, realism, graphics, and action. When I played it myself, it felt stylish, polished, and genuinely fun. What impressed me most was the way the team designed characters. Their process of creating digital figures from physical models was detailed and artistic.”

Stellar Blade has made an indelible impression as Yoshida and one of his associates agreed on the title’s potential:

“‘We absolutely want this game on PlayStation [said Yoshida’s colleague],’ and I completely agreed. When I returned to the office, I told the team, “This is a truly remarkable game.”

And that was it! With Yoshisa’s blessing, Sony Interactive Entertainment handled the game’s publishing. The seal of approval has worked out well for all parties. A Stellar Blade sequel was quietly revealed by Shift Up.

The game went on to receive a PC port, and it’s also gotten 3 new epilogues with a new update. It feels like Shift Up has a special franchise-in-the-making on its hands. Let us know if you’ve played Stellar Blade. How does it compare to other intense action games? Head to the Insider Gaming Discord Server and share your thoughts.

Also, be sure to read about Stellar Blade’s Director Admitting The Original Game’s Story is Poor. It could be one of several key upgrades over the first game.
